answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
John – I hope the following is helpful:
Iowa City, Iowa - Foundation uses crowdfunding site to raise funds for City Park log cabin restoration 
http://www.icgov.org/?artID=9107&navID=1082&type=M 
Oregon - A crowdfunding test for Gateway Green bike park project
http://bikeportland.org/2013/09/03/a-crowdfunding-test-for-gateway-green-bike-park-project-91498 
Build Gateway Green: Building a New Crowdfunding Model for Public Projects
http://www.blueoregon.com/2013/09/build-gateway-green-building-new-crowdfunding-model-public-projects/ 
Three Kickstarter-Inspired, Civically Minded Crowdfunding Sites
http://techpresident.com/news/22626/kickstarter-inspiring-civically-minded-crowdfunding-sites 
Seeking trash cans, city turns to crowd funding 
http://www.pbn.com/Seeking-trash-cans-city-turns-to-crowd-funding,92333?print=1 
Pamela Muse     
Western Regional Director   
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450    
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org

answers.author: Robert Carty
answers.text:
ICMA's Sustainable Communities blog also posted some examples this past summer: http://bit.ly/1eAWT8f. Though not specific to parks one was a rooftop garden at a high school and may have similar lessons. There are project links in the article.

author: John Elsesser
text: Has anyone used crowd funding for  a park improvement project such as a new playscape?  Is so what are the pitfalls to avoid and what makes them work better
title: Crowd funding for park improvements
